awd_titl_txt: Ab Initio Studies of the Structure and Properties of Large  Clusters Containing Heavy Elements
awd_abstract_narration: In this project in the Theoretical and Computational                       Physical Chemistry Program of the Chemistry Division, Professor                 Ermler will study relativistic effects on the bonding and                       spectroscopic properties of molecules and clusters containing                   heavy elements.                                                                                                                                                      Relativistic effective core potentials will be derived for                 lanthanide and actinide elements using computer programs that                   incorporate two-component atomic spinor basis sets and                          intermediate angular momentum coupling with configuration                       interaction.  Defects, vacancies, electronic states,                            geometries, energies, and surface properties of Group IIA                       elements and of semiconductor clusters containing Pb, Bi, and I                 will be studied.  The work will be coordinated with                             experimental scanning tunnelling microscopy and optical                         absorption spectroscopy of evaporated colloidal suspensions.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
